intro: Mosiera cuspidata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mosiera, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of East Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and finely divided, feathery leaves. Its small, yellowish-white flowers are typically arranged in umbels, a common floral structure in the carrot family. Mosiera cuspidata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
